name: EC2 Security Hardening Policy
description: Ensures EC2 instances follow AWS security best practices including IMDSv2 enforcement, IAM role usage, restricted SSH access, and detailed monitoring.
requirements: No EC2 instance should expose SSH (port 22) to the internet
All EC2 instances must use an IAM instance profile (no long-lived credentials)
EC2 instances with public IP must have explicit justification
Detailed monitoring should be enabled for visibility

controls.title: Enforce IMDSv2
controls.text: Ensure all EC2 instances enforce Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2).

controls.title: Restrict SSH Access
controls.text: Security groups should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to TCP port 22.

controls.title: Require IAM Instance Roles
controls.text: All EC2 instances must have an IAM instance profile assigned to avoid exposing access keys.

controls.title: Control Public IP Assignments
controls.text: Instances with public IPs must be tagged with 'internet-access=true' or equivalent justification.

controls.title: Enable Detailed Monitoring
controls.text: CloudWatch detailed monitoring must be enabled on EC2 instances.
